Extract features¶

Students will need to implement their own extract() method. This method receives the protocol, src, sport, dst, dport values giving information for the entire flow. Additionally, the method receives timestamps and sizes, two np.array objects giving the numerical value of the timestamps and packet sizes, respectively. In this assignment, the students should extract features from these values and output them as an array-like object, e.g., list(), np.array(), tuple.

Assignment.extract(protocol: Literal['TCP', 'UDP'], src: str, sport: int, dst: str, dport: int, timestamps: numpy.ndarray, sizes: numpy.ndarray) → List[float]¶

Extract features from each flow. Must be implemented by the students.

Parameters

  • protocol (str) – Either ‘TCP’ or ‘UDP’.

  • src (str) – Source IP address as string.

  • sport (int) – Source port.

  • dst (str) – Destination IP address as string.

  • dport (int) – Destination port.

  • timestamps (np.array of shape=(n_packets,)) – Timestamp for each packet in the flow.

  • sizes (np.array of shape=(n_packets,)) – Size of each packet in the flow.

Returns

features – Extracted features, determined by the student.

Return type

array-like of shape=(n_features,)

We create a feature matrix using the student implementation of Assignment.extract() with the feature_matrix() method. This method calls the extract() method for each flow in the dataset and transforms the output to a numpy array (matrix) of shape=``(n_flows, n_features)``. Because of the transformation to a numpy array, the output of extract() should be an array-like object.

Assignment.feature_matrix(data: Iterable[Tuple[Tuple[Literal['TCP', 'UDP'], str, int, str, int], pandas.DataFrame]]) → numpy.ndarray¶

Computes the feature matrix for the implemented ‘extract’ method.

Parameters

data (iterator) – Iterator over flow-tuple, flow-dataframe.

Returns

feature_matrix – Feature matrix for given data.

Return type

np.array of shape=(n_flows, n_features)

We show the feature matrix by transforming the output of Assignment.feature_matrix() to a pandas DataFrame, which is automatically displayed nicely in Jupyter Notebook.

Assignment.show_matrix() → None¶

Shows the feature matrix for benign flows.

  1. Extracts the feature matrix

  2. Turns it into a pd.DataFrame.

The test_extract() method loops over a given number of flows, calls the extract() method for each flow, and shows the output. This method is available for students to test their implementation of extract().

Assignment.test_extract(maximum: float = inf) → None¶

Tests the extract function implemented by students.

Parameters

maximum (float, default=float('inf')) – Maximum number of flows to test.
